definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: East Asia's Locustella warblers are a bit of a nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 東亞的蝗鶯屬有點像是鳥人的夢魘。

sentences.english: The academic honor plot nightmare which creates by the imperial civil service examination adheres to stickcohere equally likely on their body.
sentences.chinese: 由科舉造成的功名情節像夢魘一樣附着在他們身上。

sentences.english: Red nightmare, rain fall on the stump, got drunk Zen Chen flurry, u…
sentences.chinese: 紅燭夢魘，雨落花殘，撩醉了禪辰亂舞，上來流年。

sentences.english: Female bosses are a nightmare to work for, a survey of employees concludes.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一項員工調查顯示，有個女上司簡直就是夢魘。

sentences.english: The last, lingering goblin from my father's nightmare past had gasped and gone.
sentences.chinese: 終於，他夢魘中纏繞不去的最後一絲陰影也消散了。

sentences.english: The stalls were like a nightmare March Fair.
sentences.chinese: 整個劇場正廳就好像是三月節的夢魘。

sentences.english: My friend who joined KBS later than others said that he had a nightmare recently.
sentences.chinese: 我朋友比別人晚進入KBS工作，最近則受夢魘侵擾。

sentences.english: All fatally the sweet fragrance given out by the bloody rosebush, as a nightmare, bloomed right in his palm .
sentences.chinese: 血薔薇腥甜的芬芳夢魘般致命地綻放在他手心。

sentences.english: They said it should have been a nightmare, or something called ghost on bed.
sentences.chinese: 他們說應該是夢魘，也就是鬼壓牀什麼的。

sentences.english: Two year old kid just know do nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 兩歲大的小孩兒才知道做夢魘。

sentences.english: I move as in a dream—as in a nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 我腦裏一片混亂，宛如活在夢魘之中。

sentences.english: That's verging on nightmarish fiction about the clandestine operations of the US government.
sentences.chinese: 這是瀕臨夢魘小說有關的祕密行動的美國政府。

sentences.english: Who, these days, hasn't woken from a dream of murdering an angel?
sentences.chinese: 這年月，誰還沒有從謀殺一位天使的夢魘中醒來？

sentences.english: Eternity won't newer erase the nightmare to come.
sentences.chinese: 來世不會覆蓋和摸去夢魘的降臨。

sentences.english: It's kind of a nightmare for those of us trying to understand it.
sentences.chinese: 對於我們那些人來說，盡力地去了解它們是一種夢魘。

sentences.english: Losing a child is most people's worst nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 對於大多數人來說，喪子之痛是最可怕的夢魘。

definition: you can't guard against it (idiom)/impossible to defend effectively/not much one can do about it/It can't be prevented.
talking in one's sleep/words spoken during sleep/fig. speech bearing no relation to reality/delusions
to open one's eyes/to widen one's horizons
(of an illness, debt etc) to plague sb/to preoccupy sb/difficult to get rid of
to be unable to move a single step
